content: Items in Trash are automatically deleted after 30 days.

comment.text: The TrashErasureWarning translation key is used to display a notification that files in the trash will be automatically deleted after 30 days. This message appears on desktop devices as part of a warning section, reminding users of this retention policy. The translator should ensure the wording accurately conveys this automated deletion process.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The sentence structure is slightly awkward. While technically correct, it could be more natural Armenian. The phrase '30 ÷Ö÷Ä ’∞’•’ø’∏' can be improved.
The word 'eliminados' (eliminated) is a bit strong for 'deleted' in the context of a trash/recycle bin. 'Apagados' or 'removidos' would be more appropriate.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Os Itens no Lixo ser√£o automaticamente apagados ap√≥s 30 dias.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Sinhala word '‡∂ö‡∑î‡∂´‡∑î' (kunu) meaning 'dirty' or 'bad' is used for 'Trash'. While not technically incorrect, '‡∂ú‡∂∂‡∂©‡∑è ‡∂ö‡∑í‡∂ª‡∑ì‡∂∏‡∑ô‡∂±‡∑ä ‡∂â‡∑Ä‡∂≠‡∂Ω‡∂± ‡∂Ω‡∂Ø' (gabadakaramakaramen ivatalana lad) or simply '‡∂¥‡∑è‡∑Ä‡∑í‡∂Ω‡∑í ‡∂ö‡∑Ö' (pavilike kala) might be more appropriate and less colloquial for 'Trash' in this context. '‡∂ö‡∑î‡∂´‡∑î' can imply something is rotting or offensive.
The number 30 is written in Sinhala numerals ëá¨, which might be less clear to some users. It would be best to include both Sinhala and Arabic numerals for clarity.

While understandable, the sentence structure '‡∂ö‡∑î‡∂´‡∑î ‡∂ö‡∑ñ‡∂©‡∂∫‡∑ö ‡∂≠‡∑í‡∂∂‡∑ô‡∂± ‡∂ú‡∑ú‡∂±‡∑î ‡∂Ø‡∑Ä‡∑É‡∑ä ëá¨ (30) ‡∂ö‡∂ß ‡∂¥‡∑É‡∑î ‡∑É‡∑ä‡∑Ä‡∂∫‡∂Ç‡∂ö‡∑ä‚Äç‡∂ª‡∑ì‡∂∫‡∑Ä ‡∂∏‡∂ö‡∂±‡∑î ‡∂Ω‡∑ê‡∂∂‡∑ö' could be improved for better flow. The emphasis seems slightly off.  It might be more natural to state that items *will be* automatically deleted.
The verb 'izbri≈°ejo' (are deleted) doesn't agree in number with 'Elementi' (Items). It should be 'izbri≈°e' to agree with the plural subject.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Elementi v ko≈°u se samodejno izbri≈°ejo po 30 dneh.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The Serbian translation '–°—Ç–∞–≤–∫–µ —É –û—Ç–ø–∞–¥—É —Å—É –∞—É—Ç–æ–º–∞—Ç—Å–∫–∏ –æ–±—Ä–∏—Å–∞–Ω–µ –Ω–∞–∫–æ–Ω 30 –¥–∞–Ω–∞' translates to 'Items in Trash are automatically deleted after 30 days,' but the verb tense is incorrect. It implies the items *have already* been deleted, rather than the process of automatic deletion occurring after 30 days.
While '–û—Ç–ø–∞–¥' is technically correct, '–ö–æ—à–∞ –∑–∞ –æ—Ç–ø–∞—Ç–∫–µ' is more common and idiomatic when referring to a trash bin or recycle bin.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider using '–ö–æ—à–∞ –∑–∞ –æ—Ç–ø–∞—Ç–∫–µ' for better clarity and natural language.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The word 'obrisane' (deleted) is in the past tense, while the English implies a future action (automatic deletion). The Serbian should reflect the automatic, ongoing nature of the deletion.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Stavke u Otpadu ƒáe biti automatski obrisane nakon 30 dana.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While technically correct, 'Otpadu' might be perceived as slightly less formal than appropriate for a user interface. 'Koru' or 'Meƒëukorpu' are more common terms for 'Trash'.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Stavke u Koru/Meƒëukorpu ƒáe biti automatski obrisane nakon 30 dana.
